definition[0]: to repeat something in order to practise it or make sure it is correct
example[0]: Let’s run through the first scene again.
definition[1]: to read, look at, or explain something quickly
example[1]: Briefly, she ran through details of the morning’s events.
definition[2]: if a quality, feature etc runs through something, it is present in all of that thing
example[2]: This theme runs through the whole book.
definition[3]: to push a sword completely through someone
definition[4]: a short practice before a performance, test etc
example[3]: a final run-through of the play
